result.execSummary:
All charges against Scott Hamilton Davis in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Scott Hamilton Davis is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott Hamilton Davis

records.addlTxt: Moved $1500 bond on file to 21CF410. sf
22CF335 not added to current PPA on 21CF410, 21CF413. Case dismissed. Atty to submit bill within 30 days then money on file to be applied. jaf

01:05 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, DA: Karl E Anderson, DF ATTY: Matthew Dobbe, DF: Scott Hamilton Davis appeared.  Includes 21CF410, 21CF413, 21CF755 & 22CF335.  DA Anderson recites joint agreement.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- Possession of Methamphetamine- Repeater in 21CF410.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 21CF410. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 21CF410.  Also dismisses 21CF413, 21CF755 & 22CF335.  Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: Ct 1 in 21CF410

S/W 3 Years Probation 

- Court Costs: $268.00  
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00
- Court orders money on file to be applied for Atty Dobbe's fees and Court Costs, remaining to be refunded. 

- 90 Days County Jail- STAYED

- Absolute Sobriety
- AODA, driver safety plan
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Pay supervision fees
- DE to report to Probation by 4:00 PM today. 

- 2 Days Credit against ultimate sentence

Court schedules probation review hearing
Adjourned at 2:05 PM.  Probation review hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.
By Kristin N - 22R 007079. jaf        6/2/22: Moved $1500 bond on file to 21CF410. sf
